hints.content:
The number line shows $\maroonD{4}$ equal jumps of $\blueD{6}$ units.

![The same number line with each arrow labeled, plus 6](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5c9f57b68886c5b0a26cd3cc46c950a453cab175)

options.explanation:
$\maroonD{4}\times\blueD{6}=\maroonD{4}\blueD{\text{ sixes}}$.

That's the same as $\maroonD{2}\blueD{\text{ sixes}}+\maroonD{2}\blueD{\text{ sixes}}$.

![The same number line with a brace spanning the first 2 arrows labeled, 2 sixes, and a brace spanning the other 2 arrows labeled, 2 sixes](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/18d831e77d57d9c25a33a20c945f31aaaab2de8f)

$\redD{12}+\purpleC{12}=\greenD{24}$

So $\maroonD{4}\times\blueD{6}=\greenD{24}$.

question.content:
**Multiply.**  
*Hint: Use the number line below to help solve the equation.*
